item.title: Python and R
item.description: Let's talk about Pyhton and Rstudio In the Fall of 2020, I took a course called "Computational Biology and Bioinformatics" at the University of Texas, in which I learned how to navigate Rstudio and Python programming languages. What I found super interesting about these resources is that they aren't mutually exclusive and that you can actually use them both together! The two coding projects that are located in the "Projects'' tab of this website were completed solely using Rstudio; however, in this post I will show you how one can pull a file from Rstudio and complete Python functions using it.

item.title: UT Resource Recovery Experience
item.description: UT Resource Recovery Reflecting on Past Professional Experience During my junior year of college, which was from Fall 2019 to Spring 2020, I would for the Resource Recovery program at the University of Texas (UT). I was an intern for both their zero waste events and waste audit teams. After a semester of working there, my title was promoted to "Zero Waste Events Specialist". As someone who desires to spend their life working in the fields of conservation and sustainability, I cannot stress enough how grateful I am for the growth that this internship provided me.

item.title: FINALPROECT2
item.description: Introduction Bird_Nest <- read_csv("BirdNest.csv") Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest %>% select(- X1, - Page, - Species, - Nestling, - Incubate) Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest %>% na.omit() Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest[-c(11, 12, 29, 30, 21, 28),] #these rows had errors with the data (didn't match the format) Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest%>%mutate(Color_cat = case_when(Color==1 ~ "Yes", Color==0 ~ "No")) #The above code were lines I ran to set up my dataset Throughout this semester, I have been enrolled in a course called "Animal Behavior," and we have spent a lot of time discussing various species of birds as well as their behaviors (primarily those related to parental care).

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (Project 1)
item.description: Introduction: Considering that we are in the midst of a very important presidential election, I knew that I wanted to revolve this project around politics. With that being said, one of the datasets that I chose to use is titled Election08 and contains information about the 2008 United States (U.S.) presidential election on a state-by-state basis, including the District of Columbia (51 observations total). There are 7 variables within the dataset (all listed/described below) and the data primarily comes from the U.

item.title: Community Farming Project
item.description: My sophomore year of college, I was enrolled in a course called "Communicating Sustainability," which required me to complete the group project located below. For this project, a couple of classmates and I created a fake marketing agency called "GRAMS". Our goal was to explore the benefits of community farming, in the hopes that we could better market Microfarm, which is a community farm run by students at the University of Texas.

item.title: FINALPROECT2
item.description: Introduction Bird_Nest <- read_csv("BirdNest.csv") Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest %>% select(- X1, - Page, - Species, - Nestling, - Incubate) Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest %>% na.omit() Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest[-c(11, 12, 29, 30, 21, 28),] #these rows had errors with the data (didn't match the format) Bird_Nest <- Bird_Nest%>%mutate(Color_cat = case_when(Color==1 ~ "Yes", Color==0 ~ "No")) #The above code were lines I ran to set up my dataset Throughout this semester, I have been enrolled in a course called "Animal Behavior," and we have spent a lot of time discussing various species of birds as well as their behaviors (primarily those related to parental care).

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis Modeling, Inference, Prediction Here are some of my non-coding related projects: Community Farming Project
